com.esri.mo2.map.prt
Interface MapPrinter

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseMapPrinter
public interface MapPrinter

A MapPrinter captures the current state of the Map, such as MapExtent and Layers.

To print a Map, you need to first obtain a MapPrinter object, using the Map's createMapPrinter method. In your application code, call the MapPrinter's print(graphics) method to perform the actual printing.

When creating a MapPrinter, you need to specify the Map's "Imageable Area" in printer pixel units. This is a Rectangle that describes the size and location on paper of the printed Map. When your code calls the MapPrinter's print(Graphics) method, the units of the specified Graphics object will be assumed to be printer pixels (defined to be 1/72 inches).

See Also:
Map.createMapPrinter(java.awt.Rectangle)

Field Summary
static double DEFAULT_QUALITY
          Specifies the default quality setting, which is equal to 1.0.
 
Method Summary
 void print(Graphics g)

Field Detail

DEFAULT_QUALITY

public static final double DEFAULT_QUALITY
Specifies the default quality setting, which is equal to 1.0. When you use the Map to create a MapPrinter object, you can optionally choose a quality setting, or accept the default.

See Also:
Map.createMapPrinter(java.awt.Rectangle), Constant Field Values
Method Detail

print

public void print(Graphics g)
Prints the given Graphics object.
